title: Why Inflation Battered Argentinians Are Turning To Crypto
author: Javier Paz
description: A Forbes analysis found the country, with a 276% inflation rate, has the highest crypto adoption rate in the Western Hemisphere, but little use of the most trustworthy exchanges.

title: Por Qué Los Argentinos Golpeados Por La Inflación Están Recurriendo A Las Criptomonedas
author: Javier Paz
description: Un análisis de Forbes encontró que el país, el cual tiene una inflación del 276%, tiene la tasa de adopción de criptomonedas más alta del hemisferio occidental, pero poco uso de las plataformas de criptomonedas más confiables.

title: Why These Bitcoin Miners Are Becoming Summer’s Hot AI Stocks
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Crypto miners are harnessing their advanced equipment and low-cost energy for the burgeoning artificial intelligence sector. As the demand for computational power soars, these miners are uniquely positioned to profit from the AI boom.

title: Solana-Focused Fund Raises $60 Million With Promise Of Hackathon Insight
author: Veronica Irwin
description: The fund is run by Colosseum, a company that took over Solana’s hackathon program and will make early-stage investments in select winners of the six-week competitions ...

title: MtGox $9 Billion Payout Is Creditors’ Gain But Bitcoin’s Pain
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Exchange that failed in 2014 is finally returning funds to customers. Some investors fear a flood of bitcoin and bitcoin cash will destabilize the market, but others say it is an isolated event with limited long-term effect.

title: How Crypto’s Richest Billionaire Doubled His Net Worth Behind Bars
author: Javier Paz
description: Binance’s founder, known to crypto followers as CZ,  is spending the summer in Santa Barbara’s Lompoc minimum security prison. As crypto markets climb, Forbes reveals the secretive source of his ballooning billions.

title: Bitcoin Miner Core Scientific’s Stock Soars On AI Expansion Plans
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: The hunt for available data-center space is driving AI companies to purchase capacity from cryptocurrency miners, which possess the required hardware and are seeking more profitable applications for it.

title: Why FTX’s Generous Bankruptcy Payouts Still Leave Some Creditors Cold
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Despite the collapsed crypto exchange's claim of recovering enough funds to pay back most creditors, some former customers argue they’re being left in the lurch.

title: This Crypto Billionaire’s Fund Could Reap More Than $1 Billion From The FTX Bankruptcy
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: While one part of his firm was advising on asset sales, traders at Mike Novogratz’s Galaxy Digital bought a hoard of Solana tokens at a steep discount from bankrupt crypto exchange FTX. Windfall profits are likely.

title: ‘Elizabeth Warren’s Anti-Crypto Wing Is A Shrinking Iceberg’, Says Former Top Regulator
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Former CFTC Chairman Christopher Giancarlo believes that momentum on pro-crypto legislation in the U.S. is making an outcast of Senator Elizabeth Warren and other lawmakers opposed to the industry.

title: SEC Stunner: Ether ETFs Are A Go
author: Mitchell Martin
description: Regulator approves exchange requests to list spot ether funds tracking the price of the $458 billion asset. But trading won’t start right away.

title: House To Vote On Who Will Regulate Crypto
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Bill Would Put Tokens Of Centralized Blockchains Under The SEC While The Rest Go To The CFTC.

title: The World’s Most Trustworthy Crypto Exchanges And Marketplaces
author: Javier Paz
description: After years of turbulence, including jail time for the founders of the two biggest cryptocurrency exchanges, many providers are getting serious about controls and regulation. Coinbase leads our list of the 20 most trustworthy marketplaces in an industry that still requires caution.

title: It’s Disclosure Time For Hedge Funds: What Bitcoiners Should Know
author: Brandon Kochkodin
description: It’s the inaugural 13F season for Bitcoin ETFs, but not all filings are created equal. Here’s a guide for deciphering bullish bets from background noise.

title: How Crypto Giant Tether’s New CEO Is Remaking The Company For The Apocalypse
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: With $111 billion in assets and $6 billion in profits, shadowy stablecoin merchant Tether has emerged as crypto’s most profitable company. Now it's restructuring, moving into bitcoin mining, AI and education.

title: Bitcoin Mining Profitability Hits An All Time Low, But Here’s Who Is Still Thriving
author: Colin Harper
description: Bitcoin’s fierce rise has inspired a search for how to invest in it beyond just buying the ETF and holding it. Buyer beware.

title: Former Top SEC Litigator Says ‘There’s No Systematic Plan To Kill Crypto’
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Ladan Stewart heard all of the industry’s criticism as led cases against Ripple, Coinbase, and many others. Now in the private sector she wants to find common ground between crypto and the SEC.

title: Consensys Suit Is Pressing The SEC On Ether’s Security Status
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: MetaMask maker goes on offense following the warning of an impending enforcement action. The SEC says most cryptos are securities but has not clearly stated its position on ether.

title: U.S. Stablecoin Bill Would Rein In Tether, Boost Coinbase And Circle, Outlaw Algorithmics
author: Jason Brett
description: Bitcoin’s fierce rise has inspired a search for how to invest in it beyond just buying the ETF and holding it. Buyer beware.

title: The New IRS Crypto Form Brings Hidden Challenges For Taxpayers
author: Shehan Chandrasekera
description: Form 1099-DA is meant to help the IRS identify tax dodgers. Its implementation next year could create complications.

title: Anchorage Digital Bank Launches Global Settlement Network For Digital Assets
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: The San Francisco crypto custodian wants to make it easy for institutional clients to transfer their funds without compromising security.

title: IRS Releases Draft Of New Crypto Tax Form Used To Report  Transactions
author: Kelly Phillips Erb
description: The IRS has released a draft of Form 1099-DA. The form is the next step in efforts to bolster crypto tax reporting and follows proposed regulations published last year.

title: A Crypto Winter Survivor Plots A Comeback Targeting Big Ticket Investors
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: California-based crypto investment platform Abra outlasted the 2022 bloodbath despite shutting down its U.S. retail business. It is now pivoting to institutions and wealthy private clients seeking alternative crypto exposure.

title: Best Buys For The Bitcoin Halving
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Bitcoin is up 44% so far this year. Its halving could accelerate this trend and spread the gains to other stocks and tokens. Some crypto miners may face a difficult road ahead.

title: Investors Pile Into 2X Leveraged ETFs Before The Bitcoin Halving
author: Javier Paz
description: In the run-up to the fourth bitcoin halving on April 19th, a little known bitcoin futures ETF rode a 135% return in Q1, double that of spot bitcoin ETFs..

title: Former IRS Crime Chief Finds New Home At Fintech Firm Chainalysis
author: Kelly Phillips Erb
description: Former IRS-CI Chief Jim Lee has announced that he was joining Chainalysis as their Global Head of Capacity Building.

title: How A Bitcoin Supply Crunch Could Push The Price To $100,000
author: Charles Lloyd Bovaird II
description: Bitcoin’s imminent halving is coinciding with unprecedented demands from new ETFs from firms like Blackrock and Fidelity. Analysts think it could lead to explosive growth for the asset through the end of 2024.

title: Use Caution Before Investing In Bitcoin Side Projects
author: Roger Huang
description: Bitcoin’s fierce rise has inspired a search for how to invest in it beyond just buying the ETF and holding it. Buyer beware.

title: Ripple's Move Into Stablecoins Raises Key Questions For XRP’s Future
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: The San Francisco firm announced plans to enter the lucrative digital dollar market, dominated by stablecoin giants Tether and Circle. Will this weaken demand for the $32 billion market cap XRP?

title: Ethereum’s Newest ETF Applicant Wants The SEC To Delay Approvals Until  December
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan argues that the asset management industry is too focused on bitcoin products to provide ether ETFs the necessary attention to thrive.

title: How $30 Plushy Penguins Helped An NFT Company Survive Crypto Winter
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: Move over Bored Apes. Thanks to a contract with Walmart to sell stuffed toy versions of its cute aquatic birds,The Igloo Co is home to the world’s hottest NFT collection.

title: The Rise Of Crypto’s Billion Dollar Zombies
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: With bitcoin soaring once again, blockchains are suddenly much more valuable. More than 50 of them are now worth over $1 billion—despite many having few users.

title: Deciphering When To Buy And Sell Your Bitcoin

description: As volatile as ever, bitcoin is hitting new highs. But how can you tell the difference between normal trading and major bull or bear moves?

description: Bitcoin is trading near new highs. Should investors buy into other cryptocurrencies known as altcoins?

title: Beleaguered Bakkt Completes $38 Million Direct Offering

author: Steven Ehrlich
description: In this discussion we look past the groundswell of excitement surrounding the spot bitcoin ETFs and dive into key emerging topics in the industry like liquid restaking and modular blockchains. We also cover why Gupta expects us to enter into another DeFi boom.

title: Why Bitcoin’s Surge Could Be A Boon, Or Trap, For New Ether ETFs
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: The crypto industry has long resisted having its tokens classified as securities. However, the success of bitcoin’s spot ETFs, could prompt issuers like BlackRock and Fidelity to break ranks in order to comply with the SEC’s gameplan.

author: Javier Paz
description: The exchange, whose founder and CEO resigned three weeks ago, has gone dark just as bitcoin climbs toward its November 2021 all-time high of $69,000.

title: Crypto Billionaire Mike Novogratz On Bitcoin’s Next Bull Run
author: Maneet Ahuja
description: Former hedge fund star and unabashed digital asset evangelist, Mike Novogratz, believes traditional finance will drive bitcoin’s next evolution. He also rails against outdated regulations, Baby Boomers and America’s obesity problem.

title: This Crypto Darling Burned Through $2 Billion. Here’s Its Survival Strategy

author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: Digital exchange claims cryptos are not securities and that the agency is going beyond its mandate.

title: What Is The Future Of Bitcoin Futures?

description: Spot bitcoin ETFs are finally here, attracting billions and challenging all pre-existing crypto-based ETFs. Does that spell the end for bitcoin futures funds? Not so fast. ProShares is doubling down.

title: Exposing The Myth Of Decentralization

description: Never mind the recent crypto rally, for a decade the industry has been selling the promise of decentralization, a new financial system without middlemen, but many blockchain projects have recreated the very system they tried to overthrow and regulators are adamant about keeping the status quo.

title: A16z’s Chris Dixon Believes Crypto Will Unseat The Magnificant Seven
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: In his new book, Dixon argues that firms such as Alphabet, Meta, and others have reaped monopolistic profits for too long. While crypto may not be ready to overthrow these firms, he says it is only a matter of time.

description: He left the NYSE for SPAC riches, then pivoted to crypto just before the market peaked. Now Tom Farley's running the crypto exchange his SPAC failed to buy, and scooping up distressed digital assets.

title: Bitcoin Mining Stocks Soar As Firms Race To Buy New Hardware Before The Halving

description: As the crypto markets recover, yields on stablecoins across DeFi have surged to as much as 10%. Buyer beware.

author: Nina Bambysheva
description: There are many moving parts to the FTX bankruptcy, but exchange customers, especially small ones, stand to reclaim most of their lost assets if the U.S. government does not elbow them out of the way.

title: Why Tokenization Is Failing
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Proponents of crypto tokenization have long boasted that it is a killer app for financial services. So why after nearly a decade and top tier backers like Goldman Sachs to McKinsey and, hasn’t it gained any traction.

author: Mitchell Martin
description: First digital asset again worth more than all the rest combined. Bitcoin-related equities join advance.

description: FTX’s debt has soared in the last few months but still sells at less than 50% of par value.  Look carefully before you leap.

author: Javier Bastardo
description: Bitcoin has tended to bounce following rate announcements, even hikes, but they have shown not to last.

title: Requiem For Royalties: NFT Exchanges Abandon Recurring Compensation For Artists
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: OpenSea, once the leading marketplace for non-fungible tokens, was built on a promise of royalties to digital artists each time their works were resold. Then came upstart Blur, whose no-fee, trader oriented platform put the focus on pricing and costs.

title: You Can Buy Bitcoin At A Discount, If You Trust The SEC To Be Rational
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: The clock is ticking on a limited-time offer to get bitcoin on the cheap. Whether it turns out to be a bargain depends on the actions of an intransigent regulator.

title: How To Get Rich In Crypto: Four Tether Executives Are Now Billionaires
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Members of the secretive management team behind $83 billion Tether stablecoin have literally minted their own fortunes.

title: This Startup Wants To Deanonymize Blockchain. Privacy Advocates Are Furious.
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Arkham Intelligence has created a marketplace that allows people to buy and sell blockchain data. That’s bad news for the anonymity-loving world of cryptocurrencies.

title: Inside Binance’s Botched Efforts To Outwit Regulators In Europe
author: David Jeans
description: After failing to set up in the U.K., Binance built a lucrative payments business called Bifinity in Lithuania. Now its leading executives are being accused of fraud.

title: Making A Move On Ethereum
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Despite tens of billions raised and lost in the name of disruptive crypto innovations, the alternative technology has yet to produce a breakthrough product, even in video gaming. Mysten Labs’ CEO says that’s because nobody’s done it right yet.

title: Satoshi Or Not, Here He Comes
author: Michael del Castillo
description: It may not matter if Craig Wright created Bitcoin. The real question is whether the nearly 4,000 patents he controls or has pending will force computer programmers around the world to stop using open-source software as they now do—or pay up.

title: SEC Suits Say Nearly 70 Cryptos Are Securities But Proving It Will Be Difficult
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: When the SEC targeted Binance and Coinbase in lawsuits, the fallout cost more than a dozen of cryptos about $5 billion in market value. Some believe stablecoins and DeFi could be next.

title: What Japan Could Teach The U.S.—And The World—About Regulating Crypto
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: After the MtGox hack, Tokyo put in place tough rules that later protected FTX customers. Now, from that secure base, it’s moving to allow blockchain technologies to flourish.

title: Beware Of Flatcoins, Crypto’s Inflation Busting Fad
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: These coins are designed to protect stablecoin holders from inflation. But they are complicated and it’s not clear whether they will actually work.

title: Liquid Staking: Crypto’s New Phantom Money Machine
author: Javier Paz
description: Coinbase, Binance and other exchanges hold at least $2.25 billion of shadow ether, as the latest lucrative innovation in digital assets ramps up.

title: Jack Dorsey-Backed Decentralized Twitter Rival Prepares To Launch With One Million Users
author: Michael del Castillo
description: Billionaire Jack Dorsey hand selected Jay Graber to create  a social network that would let Twitter users own their own identities. Elon Musk won’t play along, but he has sparked a user exodus that offers her an opening.

title: Forget Art, Let’s Trade: How A 10-Person Startup Came To Dominate NFT Markets
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: While NFT sales declined over the past year, a new trader-focused NFT marketplace quietly dethroned OpenSea as market leader.

title: SVB Collapse Exposes Stablecoin Cracks, Regulation Likely For $100 Billion Industry
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Circle’s USD Coin ballooned to $55 billion because institutional investors trust it more than Tether. Then SVB collapsed holding billions of USDC’s reserves and breaking the digital dollar.  Finally, stablecoin regulation is coming.

title: Legal Money Laundering: How A German Bank Is Cleaning Tainted Bitcoin And Other Dirty Cryptos
author: Michael del Castillo
description: Blacklisted Bitcoin? Frankfurt’s Bankhaus Scheich has a budding business cleaning crypto and getting it back into circulation.

title: Effective Altruism-Linked Group Used Millions Donated By FTX To Buy A Czech Castle
author: Sarah Emerson
description: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX's bankruptcy proceedings could endanger some of founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s philanthropic gifts — like the one an effective altruism-aligned group used to buy a castle in Czechia.

title: Binance’s Asset Shuffling Eerily Similar To Maneuvers By FTX
author: Javier Paz
description: When you’re the world’s largest crypto exchange in a largely unregulated market, it is easy to make up the rules as you go.

title: These Companies Say They Can Recover Stolen Crypto. That Rarely Happens.
author: Cyrus Farivar
description: After being scammed for over $500,000, one man paid one such company $6,500 to recover his stolen savings. A year later, he’s received nothing — and he’s not alone.

title: Reddit Co-Founder’s Quest For Unseizable Property
author: Michael del Castillo
description: Alexis Ohanian’s ancestors perished during the Armenian genocide and had their assets seized. That generational trauma is a big reason why he’s betting heavily on NFTs and future social networks, despite crypto’s chilly winter storm.

title: How Mastercard, Goldman Sachs And Other “TradFi” Titans Are Using Blockchain To Rewire Global Finance
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Crypto is in crisis, but many of the world’s biggest financial institutions are still banking on the underlying tech as the best way to build confidence with customers—and with one another.

title: Exclusive: Sam Bankman-Fried Recalls His Hellish Week In A Caribbean Prison
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Tiny towels and stale Wonder Bread were a bother, but for the former FTX chief, jail time in the Bahamas was unbearable because he was offline. Forbes spent a day with the accused former billionaire, under house arrest in his parents California home.

title: With A New CEO, An Adult Has Arrived To Clean Up The FTX Mess
author: Amy Feldman
description: John J. Ray III, a veteran of Enron, Fruit of the Loom and other bankruptcies, now must pick up the shattered pieces from Sam Bankman-Fried’s chaotic reign.

title: Billionaire Adoption Rate Of Crypto Nearly Double Average
author: Jemima McEvoy
description: A recent survey by Forbes of 65 of the world’s wealthiest people revealed that nearly 30% are either directly or indirectly invested in cryptocurrencies, a rate that is higher than among non-billionaire investors.

title: Will Ether ETFs Revitalize Crypto? (June Issue)
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Ether ETFs are on their way. Read inside to learn what it means for this current market slump. Plus check out the newest picks for the stock and crypto portfolios.

title: What If The SEC Is Not A Monster? (May Issue)
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Congress is finally making progress towards passing crypto regulation. But at the same time it is important to remember that the SEC is not the monster that it is made out to be in this industry.

author: Steven Ehrlich
description: As Bitcoin moves past its halving, all eyes are on whether developers can build a new infrastructure on top of the $1 trillion network.

title: The Rise Of Crypto Zombies (March Issue)

description: Bitcoin just pumped past $60,000 as ETF adoption continues to grow. Here's what you should expect next along with spotlights on a number of new projects that could shine during the next bull market.

author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Yesterday bitcoin crossed the $50,000 mark for the first time since 2021.

title: Getting Closer To An Ether ETF?
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Bitcoin and ether picked up this week, and MicroStrategy makes a bold claim.

description: Jay Powell says that the Fed is going to take its time before starting rate cuts in 2024.

title: Start Your ETF Engines

description: Spot bitcoin ETFs are almost ready. Here is what you need to know to get started.

title: A Better Crypto World In 2024? (December Issue)
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: As we roll into 2024, crypto looks to turn the page on the era of Sam Bankman-Fried and Changpeng Zhao. Look inside to see what it means for investors.

author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Here is everything that you need to know about how end of year crypto trading activity will impact 2023 tax obligations.

title: SOL And Steady Wins The Race
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Solana ecosystem tokens are surging, but that does not mean that you should dive in.
